column4: If you update to 10.10 RC, is it easy to update to release version of 10.10 later on?
Further 10.10 questions should be asked in #ubuntu+1
acicula, thank you.
It doesn't.
well I don't have permissions to change my own, for some reason
How are you trying?
crontab -e. and crontab -u glaucous -e
crontab -e should JustWorkâ„¢
crontabs/glaucous/: fdopen: Permission denied
Have you done any permissions changing in /var/ ?
yes I actually had a few problems there before - so it is very possible
where in /var does crontab need permissions would you think?
Well user crontabs are stored in /var/spool/cron/ , so I'd check, using (sudo -i) whether everything looks good.  Let me see if I can get a listing of the permissions from my server here.
http://pastebin.com/a0MW19Hy is ls -lR /var/spool/cron/ from here.
thanks a lot, will use it

great it worked. Apparently all permissions and owners were wrong. This occured when I wanted to change /var to another harddrive, later on I noticed that it was a dumb idea (to do it after install). Do you know if there's a way to reset all permissions on /var?
I don't know any way of doing that beyond a reinstall. :/
damn, oh well
by the way, do I need to reload/relog for crontab changes to take effect?
Using crontab -e should do that automatically.
okay, good
After you exit crontab -e it should say something like 'installing new crontab' or something similar.
yup, its working
